info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 28 at 7:38PM CDT until May 28 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT FOR WESTERN TEXAS...EASTERN CIMARRON...WESTERN SHERMAN...DALLAM AND NORTHERN HARTLEY COUNTIES... At 738 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 9 miles south of Eva to 11 miles east of Felt to 13 miles south of Ware, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect some tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Locations impacted include... Dalhart, Stratford, Boise City, Hartley, Keyes, Eva, Ware, Conlen, Griggs and Sturgis. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
